thread.title: Rugby World Cup 2015 MasterCard Prize Draws Terms and Conditions
thread.title_full: Rugby World Cup 2015 MasterCard Prize Draws Terms and Conditions - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Rugby World Cup 2015 MasterCard Prize Draws Terms and Conditions
text: MasterCard - Rugby World Cup 2015 - Prize Draws Terms and Conditions 1. These prize draws are open to residents of the United Kingdom (England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland) aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and MasterCard Europe sprl (“MasterCard”), their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. To enter a prize draw, entrants must visit www.telegraph.co.uk/promotions/competitions to complete the required fields on the entry form and submit a Rugby World Cup 2015 themed photograph. Unsuccessful entries in each draw will be rolled over into the following draw. For the avoidance of doubt, this means that a participant may have up to six entries in the final draw. Entries cannot be amended in any way after submission. 4. All entries submitted must be the work of the individual submitting them. It is the responsibility of each entrant to ensure that their entry does not infringe the copyright of any third party or any laws. 5. Copyright in all entries submitted for this prize draw remains with the respective entrants. However, each entrant grants a worldwide, irrevocable, perpetual licence to Telegraph Media Group Limited to feature any or all of the submitted entries in any of its publications, its websites and/or in any promotional material connected to this prize draw. Entrants will not receive remittance for such publication, though their work will be credited. 6. The closing date for each draw is as follows: • Draw 1: 23:59, Tuesday, September 29, 2015; • Draw 2: 23:59, Sunday, October 4, 2015; • Draw 3: 23:59, Wednesday, October 7, 2015; • Draw 4: 23:59, Sunday, October 11, 2015; • Draw 5: 23:59, Sunday, October 18, 2015; • Draw 6: 23:59, Wednesday, October 21, 2015. 7. Late entries for a draw will not be entered into that draw but will be entered into the subsequent draws. Late entries for Draw 6 will not be accepted. Entries that are illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt, or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. 8. The winner or winners for each draw will be the first entry or entries drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date for that draw. An up to date list of the winners’ names and counties can be obtained by sending a stamped addressed envelope to MasterCard – Rugby World Cup 2015 Prize Draws Winners, SPARK, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the final prize draw. 9. The winner or winners of each draw will be contacted by the Promoter by telephone by 13:00 on the day following the closing date of the draw in which they are a winner. Should the Promoter be unable to contact a winner by this deadline or should a winner be unable to accept their prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award that prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. Winners will be required to present photo identification to collect their prize 10. The prizes as described are available on the date of publication. Should a prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value will be provided. 11. The number of winners and the prizes in each prize draw are as follow: Draw 1 • Three winners: each winner will receive two tickets to New Zealand v Tonga at St James’ Park on October 9, 2015 at 8pm. Each winner and guest will also have the option of attending the Captain’s Run, which takes place on October 7, 2015. Draw 2 • One winner: two tickets to Australia v Wales at Twickenham on October 10, 2015 at 4.45. • Two winners: each winner will receive tow tickets to England v Uruguay at Manchester City Stadium on October 10, 2015 at 8pm. Draw 3 • Two winners: each winner will receive two tickets to Quarter Final 1 (winner of Pool B v runner-up of Pool A) at Twickenham on October 17, 2015 at 4pm. Each winner and guest will also have the option of attending the winner of Pool B Captain’s Run, which takes place on October 16, 2015; • One winner: two tickets to the Quarter Final 1 (winner of Pool B v runner-up of Pool A) at Twickenham on October 17, 2015 at 8pm. The winner will also have the option of a Twickenham stadium tour for two on October 15, 2015. • One winner: two tickets to Quarter Final 2 (winner of Pool C v runner-up of Pool D) at Millennium Stadium on October 18, 2015; • One winner: two tickets to Quarter Final 2 (winner of Pool C v runner-up of Pool D) at Millennium Stadium on October 18, 2015. The winner will also meet the Man of the Match and present him with this award. Draw 4 • One winner: two tickets to Quarter Final 3 (winner of Pool D v runner-up of Pool C) at Millennium Stadium on October 18, 2015 at 1pm; • One winner: two tickets to Quarter Final 4 (winner of Pool A v runner-up of Pool B) at Twickenham on October 18, 2015 at 4pm; Draw 5 • One winner: two tickets to Semi Final 2 (winner of Quarter Final 3 v winner of Quarter Final 4) at Twickenham on October 25, 2015 at 4pm. Draw 6 • Two winners: each winner will receive two tickets to the Bronze Final (loser of Semi-Final 1 v loser of Semi-Final 2) at The Stadium at Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park on October 30, 2015 at 8pm. Each winner and guest will also have the option of attending the Captain’s Run, which takes place on October 29, 2015. 12. Where prizes include tickets, each winner and his/her guest(s) as applicable agree to comply with the terms and conditions applicable to the issue and use of tickets from time to time (as available and set out at https://tickets.rugbyworldcup.com/staticpages/termsandconditions.aspx or such other webpage as determined by Rugby World Cup Limited (“RWCL”) from time to time) and all applicable RWCL, the tournament organiser (England Rugby 2015, “ER2015”) and venue owner or operator rules and regulations relating to access to Rugby World Cup venues and any other areas associated with Rugby World Cup (including any terms of accreditation determined by RWCL). Further each winner and his/her guest(s) acknowledge that he/she may be required to enter into a direct acknowledgement and/or agreement with RWCL and/or ER2015 concerning use of the tickets and compliance with ticket terms and conditions prior to receiving the prize. 13. Any winners and/or guest(s) shall not, while using any Rugby World Cup tickets, display or publicize any political slogans or homophobic language, images of a lewd or explicitly sexual nature, images containing logos of competitors and overt brand sponsorship or anything else deemed to be ambush marketing or an abuse of the Rugby World Cup, content which is defamatory, obscene, illegal, vulgar, offensive or otherwise unsuitable or infringes others’ rights (including intellectual property rights) or reflects negatively upon any of RWCL or the Rugby World Cup. Each entrant agrees and acknowledges that any breach of this clause 13 will cause significant damage and loss to RWCL. 14. The prizes do not include travel to or from the event, accommodation, food and drink personal expenditure or incidental costs. 15. The prizes is subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 16. The winners may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of MasterCard and the Promoter. 17. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. The Promoter may pass personal information relating to prize winners to RWCL and/or ER1015 (and any of their service providers or agents) for the purposes of monitoring the distribution and use of Rugby World Cup tickets and related experiences and, in the event of a suspected breach of any terms and conditions, rules or regulations of RWCL and/or ER2015 relating to the use of such tickets and/or experiences, investigating and taking action against such winners. 18. This promotion is run by the Promoter with the permission RWCL. Accordingly the Promoter is responsible for the operation of and all matters and concerns relating to the promotion, not RWCL or any other persons involved in the staging of Rugby World Cup 2015 (including ER2015) and World Rugby (formerly the International Rugby Board), all of whom shall not be responsible for or liable to entrants in any way whatsoever in connection with this promotion. 19. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prizes impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter. Accordingly the Promoter may, at its absolute discretion, vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 20. The Telegraph is responsible for the administration of the promotion, which includes the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prizes is the responsibility of MasterCard and its agents. 21. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. telegraph.co.uk Follow @telegraph
